title: Bug 6410 - File unchanged but dirtied by code assist
description: When using code assist in a Java file, the file gets marked as dirty even if no suggestions are available. This causes unnecessary file changes.
OB: When using code assist with no suggestions available, the file is marked as dirty, indicating a change in the file.
EB: If code assist has nothing to suggest, it should not mark the file as dirty.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Open a Java file.
2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call.
3. For example, consider "I" to be the cursor below:
   Object o = anotherObject.method(I);
4. Press Ctrl + Space.
